item.title: Numerical Integration with Sparse Grids
item.description: I recently read a paper (Heiss and Winschel 2008) that advocated the use of certain techniques (Sparse Grids, SG henceforth) in numerical integration to calculate likelihood functions, as opposed to using Monte Carlo (MC henceforth) methods for the same. While approximating integrals with MC methods are simpler to implement, they might lead to integral values with considerable simulation error (Skrainka and Judd 2011). This post attempts to demonstrate the claim in Skrainka and Judd (2011) using two very simple integrals, to which we already know the value.
